step_by_step_thinking: The infant presents with a holosystolic murmur at the lower left sternal border, suggesting a ventricular septal defect (VSD). The associated symptoms of lethargy, coughing, and feeding difficulties may indicate heart failure or hypocalcemia. 22q11 deletion syndrome (DiGeorge syndrome) is strongly associated with congenital heart defects like VSD, hypocalcemia, and other features consistent with the clinical presentation. Other options (chromosome 7 deletion, lithium exposure, maternal alcohol) are less likely to directly cause the described cardiac murmur and associated symptoms.
